lines.text: I make it a point to know a little bit about everything.
[Max and Diane are acting romantic toward each other]
Would the two of you like for me to be alone?
In no way meaning to be offensive, I have always found steam baths to be... very boring.
[Lawton is wearing a bomb-coat]

I don't know if you know what this is, but when I take my thumb off this, it will explode that. And if you knew how much work it took for me to create this, then you might know how excited I am at the possibility that I might be able to use it.
I've developed a system whereby the wrongs won't keep accumulating while I continue to do what I must to maintain my style. I now do a right for every wrong, canceling out my wrongs.
I like your style.
Of course you do, because I'm a ladykiller!
[On his addiction to painkillers]
It's not enough to be stronger, faster, and better-looking than the other guys. The guys I'm after are Lex Fucking Luthor. If I'm gonna fight the Joker, I gotta have a Batmobile.
Is intelligent man who recognize opportunity in bad situation.
Tell me about it. Took the FBI six months and a brigade to grab you, took me an hour. I'm a fucking genius!
No way I can be in business with a guy who thinks he's Jesus.
Wait a minute! What if I can tell you a way to take all the money for yourself, scot free?
How dare you! I would NEVER sell out my clients, but talk fast, I'll listen.
You've been married six times? No wonder you're in pain!
What are you gonna do? Shoot me for having been in love before?
[Diane shoots him]
She shot me.
Come on, I knew you had a vest on.
She shot me!
Couldn't risk it. Come on, let's go.
[Max shoots Diane]
No!
Hurts, huh? I knew you had a vest on too, psycho bitch!
You asshole!
I hope the two of you never decide to have any children.
As you've probably figured out, I'm gonna make a mess out of you. But I think you'd be more willing to give me this information, because frankly, I'm qualified to put most of you back together again.

Have you seen Billy Jack? Ah, come on, you've seen it. If you don't get out of my way, I'm gonna take this left foot, and I'm gonna whop you right on the nose. And you know what? There ain't a damn thing you can do about it.
[Max karates the two thugs]
I hated that movie!
[Max leaps toward a closing door, and crashes into it]
Thank God nobody saw that.
God! I'd have two more guns if I wasn't such a nice guy!
So, I guess we're finally even on that saving-your-life thing.
No. When you dropped the crate on him, you evened the score, when he tried to shoot you, I saved you again.
[Approaching with a shotgun]
The proctologist will see you now.
[Garrett hits a police car]
Drinking?
If you're buying.
(Admiring a painting in Garrett Lawton's flat) Nice tits.
You can't make me believe you're giving me up for... how much is her take?
20 percent, let's say... 31 million.
Dollars?
Mmm-hmm.
Hey, so what's 31 million dollars? Max is what's priceless!
Can Max get a kiss goodbye?
[while Max and Diane are searching Garrett's hotel room, the phone rings]
Say, my watch must be fast. What time does the clock by the bed say?
[Max looks at it]
Oh, shit!
[He grabs Diane and jumps out through the window. Nothing happens]

[after a pause]
Oh... sorry. I thought it was the old "distract you on the phone while the clock bomb gets you" trick.
[Max and Diane, guns drawn, are about to storm into Garrett Lawton's hotel room]
Can I ask you something?
What?
You almost married Krezinsky's son just to get him back into the country, right?
Yeah, so?
Well, what if Krezinsky had had a daughter?
Blond or brunette?
[pause]
Oh, thank you. If I'm about to die, I want that to be the last image in my head.
[Diane punches Max]
Okay... okay, I can't hit you back.
Why not?
Because I'm *way* too tough to go around punching women!

[interrogating Max]
What are your plans?
Same as everyone, I guess. Beautiful wife, couple of kids, picket fence...
[receives another punch]
[Max passes through a metal detector, and it beeps]
Oh, you want more than one gun. You said "gun," singular. Should have told me.
[He takes out two more guns and drops them on the table. Cut to a second later, as he passes through the metal detector again, with another beep]
You wearing steel-toed shoes?

[snaps]
Of course! That's what it is.
[the bodyguard stomps on his foot, hard. Max grunts in pain and turns back to the metal detector. Cut to later as it beeps yet again]
Maybe that metal plate in your head...!
[Max grabs his arm, all the other thugs point their guns at his head]
Oh! You know what?
[takes out his back-up back-up gun]
I haven't used it for a while.
Where's Lawton?
Somewhere in Pennsylvania, I think.
Where the hell were you?
I could find any toilet paper, so I soaked some newspaper in water and that worked fine.
I make it my business to know a little bit about everything.
[Max is driving a rail cart towards the warehouse door. He draws both his guns]
Now stand back, you bastards, and let me in. And I'll huff and I'll puff, and blow your house down! All right, you bastards, get ready to die...
[He shuts his eyes as the cart crashes into the door. Max tumbles out, raising his guns]
Hands up!
[He sees he is still outside, and the door is hardly dented, and groans]
